intro: Crepis stojanovii, commonly known as the Stojanović's mouse-ear, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high elevations, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually basal, rosette-forming, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The small yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
